docs.snippet: The potential $6 billion purchase of Russia’s S-400 missile defense system comes as the United States is trying to cultivate military ties with India.

headline.main: India Is Close to Buying a Russian Missile System, Despite U.S. Sanctions
headline.print_headline: India Nears Missile Deal With Russia, Despite U.S. Sanctions

docs.snippet: President Trump’s new national security adviser mislabels a preventive attack plan, which would be illegal, as a more permissible pre-emptive strike.

headline.main: Bolton’s Illegal War Plan for North Korea

byline.original: By SCOTT D. SAGAN and ALLEN S. WEINER

docs.snippet: Anyone who's been wondering if their private Facebook data might have been swept up in the Cambridge Analytica scandal will soon get their first clues.

headline.main: Did Cambridge Analytica Get Your Data? You'll Know Soon
headline.print_headline: Did Cambridge Analytica Get Your Data? You'll Know Soon

docs.snippet: Vornado Realty Trust’s chairman said it had agreed to sell its part of the financially troubled building to the Kushners.

headline.main: Kushner Partner in 666 Fifth Ave. Says It Has Deal to Sell
headline.print_headline: Kushners Will Buy  Rest of 666 Fifth Ave., Partner Says in Filing

byline.original: By CHARLES V. BAGLI and JESSE DRUCKER

docs.snippet: Mr. Pruitt, the Environmental Protection Agency chief, has been criticized for his spending habits — and for appearing to punish those who try to rein him in.

headline.main: Scott Pruitt’s Wish List: Private Jets, Fancy Furniture, 24-Hour Security

docs.snippet: German industrial output fell by the most in more than two years in February and the sector is losing momentum, the Economy Ministry said, as factories in Europe's largest economy throttle back in the face of the rising threat of protectionism.

headline.main: German Industrial Output Slumps as Protectionism Angst Grows
headline.print_headline: German Industrial Output Slumps as Protectionism Angst Grows

docs.snippet: A judge ruled Thursday that a Frenchman will not be tried for killing two British backpackers in an Australian hostel in 2016 because of mental illness.

headline.main: Frenchman Won't Be Tried for Killing Britons in Australia
headline.print_headline: Frenchman Won't Be Tried for Killing Britons in Australia

docs.snippet: Preparing to head to Kabul, Pakistan's prime minister on Thursday reiterated his country's full support for Afghanistan's efforts to revive the long-stalled peace process with the Taliban.

headline.main: Pakistani Prime Minister to Head to Kabul on Landmark Visit
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Prime Minister to Head to Kabul on Landmark Visit

docs.snippet: The U.S. National Guard faces a vastly different environment than it did on its last two deployments to the border with Mexico, with far fewer illegal crossings and more Central Americans than Mexicans coming.

headline.main: 'Eyes and Ears': Past Guard Border Deployments Offer Clues
headline.print_headline: 'Eyes and Ears': Past Guard Border Deployments Offer Clues

docs.snippet: As a stock rebound on Thursday put the S&P 500 on track for its strongest three-day performance since 2016, a look at the recent performance of most of the index's components paints a different picture, illustrating signs of weakness in Wall S...

headline.main: As S&P 500 Recovers, Most Components Remain in Correction-Or Worse
headline.print_headline: As S&P 500 Recovers, Most Components Remain in Correction-Or Worse
